name: Game
description:
There is a legend in the IT City college. A student that failed to answer all
questions on the game theory exam is given one more chance by his professor.
The student has to play a game with the professor. The game is played on a
square field consisting of n × n cells. Initially all cells are empty. On each
turn a player chooses and paint an empty cell that has no common sides with
previously painted cells. Adjacent corner of painted cells is allowed. On the
next turn another player does the same, then the first one and so on. The
player with no cells to paint on his turn loses. The professor have chosen the
field size n and allowed the student to choose to be the first or the second
player in the game. What should the student choose to win the game? Both
players play optimally. Input The only line of the input contains one integer
n (1 ≤ n ≤ 10^18) — the size of the field. Output Output number 1, if the
player making the first turn wins when both players play optimally, otherwise
print number 2. Examples Input 1 Output 1 Input 2 Output 2
